results.title: Hybrid molecules synergistically acting against protein aggregation diseases.
results.text_hl: An emerging common feature of the age-associated @DISEASE_Neurodegenerative_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D019636 @@@neurodegenerative disorders@@@ like @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer's disease@@@ (@DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@) and @<m>DISEASE_Creutzfeldt_Jakob_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007562 @@@Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Creutzfeldt_Jakob_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007562 @@@CJD@@@) is the ability of many disease-associated protein aggregates to induce conversion of a normal counterpart conformer leading to an acceleration of disease progression.

citations.NLM: Korth C, Klingenstein R, Müller-Schiffmann A. Hybrid molecules synergistically acting against protein aggregation diseases. Curr Top Med Chem. 2013;13(19):2484-90. PMID: 24059335
citations.BibTeX: @article{24059335, title={Hybrid molecules synergistically acting against protein aggregation diseases.}, author={Korth C and Klingenstein R and Müller-Schiffmann A}, journal={Curr Top Med Chem}, volume={13}, number={19}, pages={2484-90}}

results.title: Tricyclic antidepressants, quinacrine and a novel, synthetic chimera thereof clear prions by destabilizing detergent-resistant membrane compartments.
results.text_hl: Our data suggest that a cocktail of drugs targeting the @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ metabolism that controls @GENE_PRNP @GENE_5621 @@@PrP@@@ conversion may be the most efficient in treating @<m>DISEASE_Creutzfeldt_Jakob_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007562 @@@Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Klingenstein R, Löber S, Kujala P, Godsave S, Leliveld SR, Gmeiner P, Peters PJ, Korth C. Tricyclic antidepressants, quinacrine and a novel, synthetic chimera thereof clear prions by destabilizing detergent-resistant membrane compartments. J Neurochem. 2006 Aug;98(3):748-59. PMID: 16749906
citations.BibTeX: @article{16749906, title={Tricyclic antidepressants, quinacrine and a novel, synthetic chimera thereof clear prions by destabilizing detergent-resistant membrane compartments.}, author={Klingenstein R and Löber S and Kujala P and Godsave S and Leliveld SR and Gmeiner P and Peters PJ and Korth C}, journal={J Neurochem}, volume={98}, number={3}, pages={748-59}}
